author: A Brinton Cooper III
comment: This is an update. App no longer permits reading in landscape mode on 9.7-inch Android tablet. Photo albums frequently omit important caption information. Other than that, it works fine.  What's below was written 9 months ago. The Sun app has worked well since...until yesterday, when it stopped recognizing my ongoing payments made directly to the newspaper. Now, it treats me as a nonsubscriber, severely limiting my access to articles.  What's worse is that the Sun's representative for mobile apps has no idea how to fix it. So I must downgrade the app.  The latest version has been stable since installation. Former crashes and freezes are gone; articles scroll smoothly. Compared with other news apps, however, Sun articles load very slowly.  This gets worse as one moves from the current news menus to the Obituaries and Harford news to the right. Sometimes it takes 30 seconds after being selected for a piece to appear. I wonder if they're using an old, pokey server?

App is seriously flawed. Keeps nagging me to suscribe to be able to read articles, even though I am a 7-day print subscriber. And when I tried to send a feedback email through the app, the email bounced. Needs work.

author: Henry Farkas
comment: Better than most national news apps. Has local news as well as national and worldwide news. Has great control of text size and font. I can't seem to find the weather in this app. That's why I gave it four stars instead of five.
Good content but terrible app.

author: Ryan Frizzell
comment: Only 5 free stories per month.  Uninstall.

author: Neith Little
comment: Easy to use, complements my weekend hard-copy subscription well.

author: Evan Nelson
comment: Unstable and slow.

author: rob b
comment: Awesome.well written.always up to the minute news. Good ole journalism.

author: Jonathan White
comment: Dislike the app's layout, and the one-sided tilt of much of its content. Plus it's expensive. Still need to have it in Maryland.

author: Alan Peltzer
comment: I am been getting home delivery of the Sun for years and have always been able to read unlimited online content at no additional cost. Now I need to pay 7.99 a month to read online.

author: Derek Jones
comment: Assisted Living/Business Services
title: Owner of Four League LLC

author: marc wisner
comment: Sucks

author: Tom Moseley
comment: Most unstable app. Crashes almost every time you open it. If this the best Tronc can do, they should sell now.

author: alex b
comment: Its a good app, easy to navigate, doesnt crash often, up to date news

author: Susan Dreyer
comment: Titles of articles are not what I'm looking for.  I like the NYT format with short summaries. It's not easy at a glance to see a lot of content in the Sun's current format.  I don't want video, I want to read the news. Give me more text.
title: Need paragraph summary

author: Crystal McDermott
comment: The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because it lacks the music listing.
title: Really Good

author: Adam Kautz
comment: Only lets you read 5 stories for free per month before prompting you to purchase a $7.99 monthly subscription. And even with a subscription (i tried it) they still require you to watch ads before you can read many of the articles.

author: Five Star Beauty, Inc.
comment: Fast, up to the minute reporting and articles. Informative and multiple perspectives. I have no trouble with the app.

author: Bob Martin
comment: Can you please have the articles load at least as fast as the ads?
title: Great idea

author: Gary Raffel
comment: Slow, awkward to use
title: Poor execution

author: Jenn T
comment: Really? I only get 10 articles on an ad supported app. Ridiculous. Back to chrome incognito mode for then.
title: 10  articles only

author: Vincent Stewart
comment: Bias reporting Marylanders thinks polls should be  dropped

author: James Hall
comment: The articles often hang such that all you can see is part of a big letter while the advertisement is unsuccessfully trying to load. The e edition of the paper from the web is the best way for me to read today's content. Love the paper, not a huge fan of the app
title: Buggy app

author: Nicholas Morosoff
comment: Horrible app.  I have had to uninstall and reinstall multiple times.  They have not figured out how to track my subscription.

author: James Jones
comment: It does not compare favourably with the WashPost site which I find easy to read and well organized.
title: Not coherent

author: Warrick St Jean
comment: I was so impressed with the convenience and value of the app, that I subscribed. Since then I have continued to enjoy the excellent articles when I'm not dealing with a subscription bug which seems to forget that I am allowed unlimited access from time to time. Hopefully others will be as patient and persistent because of the strong writing
title: Great content, great value, buggy app

author: neil lovinger
comment: Awesome app.  Up to date news in Baltimore.  No problems.
title: SUN

author: Walter Ambrose
comment: Site operates poorly, freezes, won't open. Poor layout. Unfortunately if you want local news your stuck with this trash.
title: Sun

author: Margaret Cole
comment: Mrs cole

author: RUSSELL HENNINGER Sr
comment: Excellent.....always getting updates
title: Baltimore Sun

author: Eric is My-Appliance-Guy
comment: Very annoying as it pushes notifications all the time. Easier to read and much cleaner than the paper version.
title: Meh at best

author: kevin miskelly
comment: Slow. The Sunpaper is a ghost of what it used to be.
title: Sun app

author: Jim Wiedman
comment: Good newspaper, but my subscription access via Google onky worked on my phone occasionally. I could never tell if I was going to be able to read an article until I clicked on it.

reply.author: tronc Inc.
reply.content:
Jim,

We're sorry you're having issues with your subscription.  The latest release has some fixes that should address your issue - if you're still having trouble accessing your subscription after updating, please contact us at mobile@baltimoresun.com

title: Subscription Quirks

author: Zoë Lkjsdhf
comment: Have to pay to read more then a few articles, no way!
title: Have to pay to read articles?

author: Marcus Fugett
comment: The app itself is good, the layout is clean and it operates super smooth. The picture zooming with captions is wonderful. However there are a few sticking points. Videos do not play, either bundle some implementation of flash or use another web codec. Also, there is no access to comments made on articles. Seems like too many news apps do this, and this is another one. Other than those 2 pain points, it is pretty surprising how well do e it is. Now please, finish the job!
title: Halfway there

author: Peter Fitzgerald
comment: This one has come long, long way. The new interface looks great.
title: Great update

author: Yehuda Dax
comment: User friendly but uninformative

author: CHRISTINE Frisch
comment: The app is awesome.
title: Love It....

author: Steve Frew
comment: Living outside of Baltimore Sun delivery area makes this an awesome app for Me!! Go Orioles!! Playoff Bound!
title: Great for Orioles Fans!

author: Mary Barnes
comment: Newly Published Author/Artist of Urban Poetry
title: The Unique North Star -Undiscovered Genius
